comments: Number of partitions of n into 3 summands 0<a<=b<=c with b/a and c/b integers.a(n) is the number of 1's in n-th row of array T given by A049816. E.g. there are 5 numbers k from 1 to 13 for which the Euclidean algorithm on (13,k) has exactly 1 nonzero remainder; hence a(13)=5.
mathematica: a[n_] := 1 - DivisorSigma[0, n] + DivisorSum[n, If[# == 1, 0, DivisorSigma[ 0, # - 1]]& ]; Array[a, 90] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Dec 02 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n) = 1 - numdiv(n) + sumdiv(n, d, if (d==1, 0, numdiv(d-1))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 01 2013
crossrefs: Cf. A069905 Number of partitions of n into 3 positive parts.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: Additional comments from _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 23 2003, _Zak Seidov_, Aug 31 2006 and _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Sep 20 2006
Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 21 2006
